Package io.github.frc5024.lib5k.control_loops.statespace.wrappers

Class SimpleFlywheelController

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.frc5024.lib5k.control_loops.statespace.wrappers.SimpleFlywheelController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SystemCharacteristics, StateSpaceSystem
    public class SimpleFlywheelController
extends java.lang.Object
implements StateSpaceSystem
    This is a wrapper around a state space plant, observer, and LQR. The SimpleFlywheelController class is designed to allow grade 9, and new programmers to make use of state space-based flywheel control without having to worry about the actual math happening BTS. See for information on the math going on here: https://file.tavsys.net/control/controls-engineering-in-frc.pdf#%5B%7B%22num%22%3A40%2C%22gen%22%3A0%7D%2C%7B%22name%22%3A%22XYZ%22%7D%2C85.04%2C265.56%2Cnull%5D

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleFlywheelController

        public SimpleFlywheelController​(DCBrushedMotor motorType,
                                double launcherMassKg,
                                double launcherDiameterM,
                                double maxVelocityRPM,
                                double gearing,
                                double maxVoltageOutput,
                                double epsilonRPM)
        Create a SimpleFlywheelController
        Parameters:
        motorType - The type of motor(s) used to drive the flywheel
        launcherMassKg - The mass in kg of all the wheels that come in contact with the launched object
        launcherDiameterM - The diameter in m of one of the wheels that come in contact with the launched object
        maxVelocityRPM - The realistic maximum velocity of the flywheel when the maximum voltage is applied. This must NOT be the velocity written on the motor datasheet, and should be measured via an encoder or tacheometer.
        gearing - reduction between motors and encoder, as output over input. If the flywheel spins slower than the motors, this number should be greater than one. IGNORE THIS IF THE ENCODER IS ATTACHED TO THE MOTOR
        maxVoltageOutput - The maximum voltage to output. This is generally 12.0
        epsilonRPM - Epsilon in RPM. A good starting point is probably 80-100

      • SimpleFlywheelController

        public SimpleFlywheelController​(DCBrushedMotor motorType,
                                double launcherMassKg,
                                double launcherDiameterM,
                                double flywheelMassKg,
                                double flywheelDiameterM,
                                double maxVelocityRPM,
                                double gearing,
                                double maxVoltageOutput,
                                double epsilonRPM)
        Create a SimpleFlywheelController
        Parameters:
        motorType - The type of motor(s) used to drive the flywheel
        launcherMassKg - The mass in kg of all the wheels that come in contact with the launched object
        launcherDiameterM - The diameter in m of one of the wheels that come in contact with the launched object
        flywheelMassKg - The mass in kg of the extra weight added to the flywheel for momentum (0.0 if none attached)
        flywheelDiameterM - The diameter in m of the extra weight added to the flywheel for momentum (0.0 if none attached)
        maxVelocityRPM - The realistic maximum velocity of the flywheel when the maximum voltage is applied. This must NOT be the velocity written on the motor datasheet, and should be measured via an encoder or tacheometer.
        gearing - reduction between motors and encoder, as output over input. If the flywheel spins slower than the motors, this number should be greater than one. IGNORE THIS IF THE ENCODER IS ATTACHED TO THE MOTOR
        maxVoltageOutput - The maximum voltage to output. This is generally 12.0
        epsilonRPM - Epsilon in RPM. A good starting point is probably 80-100

      • SimpleFlywheelController

        public SimpleFlywheelController​(DCBrushedMotor motorType,
                                double launcherMassKg,
                                double launcherDiameterM,
                                double flywheelMassKg,
                                double flywheelDiameterM,
                                double maxVelocityRPM,
                                double gearing,
                                double modelAccuracy,
                                double encoderAccuracy,
                                double expectedLoopTimeSeconds,
                                double maxVoltageOutput,
                                double epsilonRPM)
        Create a SimpleFlywheelController
        Parameters:
        motorType - The type of motor(s) used to drive the flywheel
        launcherMassKg - The mass in kg of all the wheels that come in contact with the launched object
        launcherDiameterM - The diameter in m of one of the wheels that come in contact with the launched object
        flywheelMassKg - The mass in kg of the extra weight added to the flywheel for momentum (0.0 if none attached)
        flywheelDiameterM - The diameter in m of the extra weight added to the flywheel for momentum (0.0 if none attached)
        maxVelocityRPM - The realistic maximum velocity of the flywheel when the maximum voltage is applied. This must NOT be the velocity written on the motor datasheet, and should be measured via an encoder or tacheometer.
        gearing - reduction between motors and encoder, as output over input. If the flywheel spins slower than the motors, this number should be greater than one. IGNORE THIS IF THE ENCODER IS ATTACHED TO THE MOTOR
        modelAccuracy - How accurate we think the model is in RPM
        encoderAccuracy - How accurate we think the encoder is in RPM
        expectedLoopTimeSeconds - The loop period of the caller in seconds. This is generally 0.02 (20ms)
        maxVoltageOutput - The maximum voltage to output. This is generally 12.0
        epsilonRPM - Epsilon in RPM. A good starting point is probably 80-100
